Participants.evidence: This multicentre retrospective analysis included 86 patients with heat stroke patients who underwent cranial computed tomography (CT).

Objective.evidence: we aimed to evaluate the prognostic value of GWR for predicting neurological outcome in heat stroke patients.

Method_Outcome.evidence: Patients were stratified by Cerebral Performance Category (CPC) scores at discharge: good outcome (CPC 1–2, n = 65) versus poor outcome (CPC 3–5, n = 21) in the derivation cohort.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Patients were stratified by Cerebral Performance Category (CPC) scores at discharge: good outcome (CPC 1–2, n = 65) versus poor outcome (CPC 3–5, n = 21) in the derivation cohort.

Result_Outcome.evidence: ROC analysis showed the following areas under the curve: PU/CC, 0.836; CN/PLIC, 0.815; CN/CC, 0.858; PU/PLIC, 0.814; GWR basal ganglia , 0.855; GWR cerebrum , 0.803; GWR average , 0.837.
